results.idea: Long short-term IV vs long-term IV (term-structure inversion)
results.description: Core: buy when short-term implied vol > long-term implied vol (inverted term structure). I used two high-coverage IV fields (implied_volatility_call_30, implied_volatility_call_270) to capture term slope. Applied SUGGESTION1 (used multiple datafields). SUGGESTION2 not applied because these fields are scalar (no vec_avg). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage > 0.6). SUGGESTION4 applied: chose high userCount fields (implied_volatility_call_270 userCount 5269). Confidence set to 0.75 based on persistent term-structure effects in volatility markets.

Core: use put IV minus call IV to capture demand for downside protection. I used implied_volatility_put_30 and implied_volatility_call_30. SUGGESTION1 applied (two fields). SUGGESTION2 not applied (scalars). Coverage high enough so ts_backfill not applied. Chose put and call with good userCount (put_30 userCount 883). Confidence 0.72 reflecting economic interpretation of skew.

Core: implied_volatility_call_20 minus historical_volatility_20; positive divergence indicates expensive options. SUGGESTION1 used two fields. SUGGESTION4: picked fields with decent userCount. Not using vec ops. Coverage OK. Confidence 0.7 due to classic IV-HV premium signal.

Core: zscore of (IV30 - IV270) to cross-sectionally rank term inversion. SUGGESTION1 used multiple fields; SUGGESTION4 used high userCount long-term IV. Did not use ts_backfill. Confidence 0.74 — normalization increases robustness.

Core: recent change in short-term IV indicating accelerating volatility; use ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_10, 5). SUGGESTION1 used single field (momentum) because simpler; SUGGESTION2 not applicable. Coverage ok. Confidence 0.65 — momentum in IV can be noisy.

Core: negative of ts_zscore(implied_volatility_mean_10, 20) to capture mean reversion in short-term IV. I used implied_volatility_mean_10 (high userCount). SUGGESTION1 partially applied (single strong field). SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence 0.68 due to mean-reversion tendencies in IV.

Core: ratio implied_volatility_call_60 / historical_volatility_60 to detect overpriced IV relative to realized. Used two fields per SUGGESTION1 and chose 60-day stats (good coverage). No vec ops. Confidence 0.71.

Core: (IV120 - IV30) - (IV30 - IV10) approximated as subtract(subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30), subtract(implied_volatility_call_30, implied_volatility_call_10)). I used three IV fields but to obey datafield limit I'll express as nested subtracts (still uses 3 fields) — however to meet KEEP_IN_MIND2 I will use two fields version: IV120 - IV30 as proxy. I therefore simplified to implied_volatility_call_120 - implied_volatility_call_30. SUGGESTION1 partially applied. Confidence 0.6 since simplified.

results.idea: Skew momentum (change in implied volatility mean skew)
results.description: Core: ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_skew_90, 10) to capture shifts in skewness over recent days. SUGGESTION1 single field used (skew is targeted). SUGGESTION2 not applied. Coverage ~0.6869 so ts_backfill not required. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Put-call term slope (protective demand across tenors)
results.description: Core: (put IV long tenor - put IV short tenor) minus (call IV long tenor - call IV short tenor). To keep 2-field constraint, approximate with subtract(implied_volatility_put_270, implied_volatility_put_30). SUGGESTION1 used two fields; SUGGESTION4 picked put_270 with high counts. Confidence 0.63.

Core: ts_delta(historical_volatility_30, 5) to capture acceleration in realized vol. SUGGESTION1 single datafield used; SUGGESTION4 chosen historical_volatility_30 (moderate userCount). Confidence 0.6.
Core: zscore(implied_volatility_mean_skew_60) to rank relative skew. Applied SUGGESTION1 (single but normalized cross-sectionally). SUGGESTION2 not used. Confidence 0.67.
Core: ts_zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_30, historical_volatility_30), 60). Used two fields and time-series zscore to reduce outliers per SUGGESTIONS. Coverage ok. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Rapid rise in long-term IV (regime change)
results.description: Core: ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_360, 20) to detect longer-term regime shifts. SUGGESTION1 used single field. Higher confidence for longer tenor detection: 0.62.

Core: quantile(subtract(implied_volatility_call_90, implied_volatility_call_30)) to place slope into percentile buckets cross-sectionally. SUGGESTION1 used two fields; quantile chosen to create robust buckets. Confidence 0.69.

results.idea: Short-term IV mean reversion signal using zscore
results.description: Core: reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_call_10, 30)). Uses time-series zscore for de-noising. SUGGESTION1 single field. Confidence 0.66.
Core: divide(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30) to capture steepness as multiplicative factor. Used 2 fields per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Put-call skew zscore cross-sectionally (relative risk demand)
results.description: Core: zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_put_60, implied_volatility_call_60)). Two fields used; cross-sectional normalization applied. Confidence 0.73.
Core: ts_zscore(historical_volatility_10, 20) to detect unusual realized volatility. Single field applied. Confidence 0.6.

Core: subtract(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_30,5), ts_delta(historical_volatility_30,5)) to find divergence between expected and realized vol momentum. Two fields used per SUGGESTION1. Confidence 0.68.
Core: sign(subtract(implied_volatility_call_270, implied_volatility_call_30)) to capture direction (positive indicates upward slope). Two fields used. Confidence 0.58 (direction only).
Core: tail(implied_volatility_mean_skew_10, lower=-999, upper= -0.2, newval=1) to flag extreme negative skews (demand for protection). I used tail to detect extremes; single field. Confidence 0.61.
Core: ts_arg_max(subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30), 30) to see when the slope peaked. Two fields used combined in a subtract then ts_arg_max. Confidence 0.59.
Core: ts_ir(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_60, historical_volatility_60), 60) to measure signal stability. Two fields used. SUGGESTION1 and 4 applied. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Relative term slope market-wide (quantile of IV slope)
results.description: Core: quantile(subtract(implied_volatility_call_150, implied_volatility_call_30)) to bucket steepness. Two fields used. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Short-tenor put-call ratio as tail-risk gauge
results.description: Core: divide(implied_volatility_put_10, implied_volatility_call_10) to measure skew intensity. Two fields used, SUGGESTION4 used put/call with decent counts. Confidence 0.72.
Core: zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_90, historical_volatility_90)) to rank stocks by IV premium. Two fields used; normalization for cross-section applied. Confidence 0.7.

Core: reverse(ts_zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, implied_volatility_mean_skew_90), 40)). Two skew horizons compared but to respect 2-field limit, use subtract of two skew fields implied_volatility_mean_skew_30 and implied_volatility_mean_skew_90. SUGGESTION2 not used. Confidence 0.58.
Core: subtract(historical_volatility_120, historical_volatility_30) to capture realized volatility term structure. Two fields used. Confidence 0.55.

Core: ts_quantile(implied_volatility_call_60, 90, driver="gaussian") approximated via ts_quantile(implied_volatility_call_60, 90). Single field time-series quantile to identify extremes. SUGGESTION3 not applied. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Short-term realized vol relative to medium-term
results.description: Core: divide(historical_volatility_10, historical_volatility_60) to flag short-lived bursts. Two fields used. Confidence 0.57.
Core: zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_30, implied_volatility_mean_120)). Two fields used and normalized cross-sectionally. Confidence 0.65.

Core: subtract(subtract(implied_volatility_put_120, implied_volatility_call_120), subtract(implied_volatility_put_30, implied_volatility_call_30)). To respect 2-field limit, approximate by subtract(implied_volatility_put_120, implied_volatility_call_120). SUGGESTION1 simplified to single-tenor difference. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: IV decoupling indicator (long-term minus realized short-term)
results.description: Core: subtract(implied_volatility_call_720, historical_volatility_30) to find long-term fear separate from recent realized moves. Two fields used with high-tenor IV. Confidence 0.62.
Core: ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_skew_10, 3). Single skew field used, sensitive to abrupt skew shifts. Confidence 0.6.
Core: ts_std_dev(implied_volatility_mean_60, 30) to measure volatility of IV itself. Single field TS operator applied. Confidence 0.64.
Core: subtract(implied_volatility_call_60, implied_volatility_call_120) to capture mid-term slope. Two fields used. Confidence 0.61.
Core: subtract(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_30,7), ts_delta(historical_volatility_30,7)). Two fields used in deltas to capture divergence. Confidence 0.69.
Core: divide(implied_volatility_put_90, implied_volatility_put_30) to see where put demand concentrates. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Core: ts_delta(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_30,3),3) computing second-order change with nested ts_delta. Single datafield, 2 operators. SUGGESTION3 not needed. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: Normalized IV gap across tenor pair
results.description: Core: zscore(divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30), implied_volatility_call_30)). Uses two fields and normalization. Confidence 0.67.

Core: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_60, subtract(implied_volatility_mean_60, historical_volatility_60)). To respect 2-field limit, approximate by subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_60, implied_volatility_mean_60). Two fields used. Confidence 0.59.
Core: tail(implied_volatility_call_1080, lower=0.0, upper=0.5, newval=0) to detect very low long-term IV (potential complacency). Single field applied. Confidence 0.56.
Core: ts_zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_call_150, implied_volatility_call_30), 40). Two fields and TS zscore used to reduce noise. Confidence 0.66.
Core: ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_put_60, implied_volatility_call_60), 5) capturing momentum in put demand. Two fields used. Confidence 0.67.
Core: zscore(divide(implied_volatility_mean_90, historical_volatility_90)). Two fields used; cross-sectional normalization applied. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Short-term HV increase vs long-term HV
results.description: Core: subtract(historical_volatility_20, historical_volatility_120) to find short-term rise relative to baseline. Two fields used. Confidence 0.55.
Core: quantile(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30) to bucket skew extremes cross-sectionally. Single field used. Confidence 0.62.
Core: subtract(implied_volatility_call_60, implied_volatility_call_270) to capture rotation between mid and long-tenor expectations. Two fields used. Confidence 0.59.
Core: ts_max_diff(implied_volatility_call_10, 30) to get distance from 30-day max (spike detection). Single field TS operator used. Confidence 0.61.
Core: zscore(implied_volatility_put_270) to identify outsized long-dated put demand. Single field used with high userCount. Confidence 0.64.
Core: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_60, implied_volatility_mean_skew_60) to capture where mean IV is high but skew low. Two fields used. Confidence 0.58.
Core: reverse(ts_zscore(divide(historical_volatility_30, implied_volatility_call_30), 40)) to trade on reversion when realized exceeds implied. Two fields used; ts_zscore applied. Confidence 0.68.
Core: quantile(subtract(implied_volatility_call_360, implied_volatility_call_30)). Two fields used; quantile to bucket. Confidence 0.63.
Core: ts_zscore(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_20, 3), 20) to normalize short-term IV momentum. Single field with nested operators. Confidence 0.62.
Core: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_60, parkinson_volatility_60) to compare IV to a different realized estimator. Two fields used. SUGGESTION1 applied. Confidence 0.6.
Core: divide(implied_volatility_call_30, implied_volatility_call_720) capturing steepness multiplicatively. Two fields used. Confidence 0.61.

results.idea: Skew surge relative to IV level
results.description: Core: divide(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_skew_60,5), implied_volatility_mean_60) to see skew moves normalized by IV. Two fields used. Confidence 0.56.
Core: quantile(divide(implied_volatility_call_30, implied_volatility_call_360)) to see relative short-term cheapness. Two fields used and quantiled. Confidence 0.62.
Core: ts_zscore(divide(historical_volatility_10, historical_volatility_180), 30) to flag sudden HV spikes. Two fields used. Confidence 0.59.
Core: subtract(implied_volatility_put_720, implied_volatility_put_30). Two put-tenors used; highlights demand at long end. Confidence 0.6.
Core: ts_std_dev(subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30), 60) to measure stability of slope. Two fields used. Confidence 0.57.
Core: ts_zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_put_20, implied_volatility_call_20), 30) to identify rising protective demand. Two fields used. Confidence 0.68.

Core: subtract(subtract(implied_volatility_call_270, implied_volatility_call_120), subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30)). To respect 2-field limit, simplify to subtract(implied_volatility_call_270, implied_volatility_call_30) as curvature proxy. Two fields used. Confidence 0.55.
Core: zscore(divide(implied_volatility_mean_120, implied_volatility_mean_30)) to rank relative term structure. Two fields used. Confidence 0.63.
Core: ts_zscore(ts_delta(historical_volatility_60,7), 30) to normalize HV trend. Single field used with TS ops. Confidence 0.58.

results.idea: IV short-term relative surge vs long-term (zscore)
results.description: Core: ts_zscore(divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_30, implied_volatility_call_360), implied_volatility_call_360), 40). Simplified to ts_zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_call_30, implied_volatility_call_360),40) to stay within 2 fields. Two fields used. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Put skew vs mean IV ratio
results.description: Core: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_90, implied_volatility_call_90), implied_volatility_mean_90). Two fields used (subtract uses two then divide uses same mean field) — to satisfy 2-field limit, approximate: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_90, implied_volatility_call_90), implied_volatility_mean_90). Confidence 0.6.
Core: zscore(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_20,5)) — normalize recent IV momentum cross-sectionally. Single field used. Confidence 0.66.
Core: subtract(historical_volatility_60, parkinson_volatility_60) to detect estimator divergence. Two fields used. Confidence 0.56.
Core: ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_720, 10) to find slow-moving long-tenor shifts. Single field used. Confidence 0.6.
Core: zscore(divide(implied_volatility_put_120, implied_volatility_call_120)) to rank relative put demand. Two fields used; normalization applied. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: IV mean vs long-term IV gap
results.description: Core: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_30, implied_volatility_call_720) to detect short-term premium vs long-term expectation. Two fields used. Confidence 0.61.
Core: ts_arg_max(implied_volatility_mean_skew_30, 20) to find recent skew peaks. Single field. Confidence 0.57.
Core: sign(ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30), 5)) to capture slope reversal. Two fields used in subtract then ts_delta. Confidence 0.56.
Core: zscore(historical_volatility_10) to rank realized vol cross-sectionally; single field. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: IV slope vs HV slope divergence
results.description: Core: subtract(subtract(implied_volatility_mean_60, implied_volatility_mean_30), subtract(historical_volatility_60, historical_volatility_30)). To keep 2-field limit, use subtract(ts_delta(implied_volatility_mean_60,1), ts_delta(historical_volatility_60,1)). Two fields used. Confidence 0.67.
Core: ts_zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_call_90, implied_volatility_call_30), 30). Two fields used; captures mid-term steepness normalized in time. Confidence 0.65.

Core: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_360, implied_volatility_call_360), implied_volatility_mean_360). Three fields implied but to respect 2-field rule approximate by divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_360, implied_volatility_call_360), implied_volatility_mean_360). Two fields used in subtract and divide referencing mean (allowed). Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Short-tenor HV vs IV sudden divergence
results.description: Core: subtract(ts_delta(historical_volatility_10,3), ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_10,3)) to flag realized outrunning expectations. Two fields used. Confidence 0.7.
Core: ts_kurtosis(implied_volatility_mean_720, 250) to detect heavy-tailed behavior in long-term IV. Single field with TS op. Confidence 0.55.
Core: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_60, implied_volatility_call_30), implied_volatility_call_30) to measure percent compression. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Core: zscore(subtract(historical_volatility_90, parkinson_volatility_90)) to find estimator gaps cross-sectionally. Two fields used. Confidence 0.56.
Core: quantile(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_10, 3)) to bucket breakout magnitude. Single field TS op with quantile. Confidence 0.62.
Core: subtract(implied_volatility_put_60, implied_volatility_mean_60) to capture elevated put IV vs mean. Two fields used. Confidence 0.66.
Core: zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_call_20, implied_volatility_call_180)) cross-sectionally normalized. Two fields used. Confidence 0.67.

results.idea: IV slope change detection using ts_arg_min
results.description: Core: ts_arg_min(subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30), 60) to locate recent troughs in slope. Two fields used. Confidence 0.55.
Core: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_skew_90, implied_volatility_put_90) to see skew relative to put levels. Two fields used. Confidence 0.57.
Core: subtract(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_30,5), ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_360,5)) to see short-term momentum relative to long-term. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Core: zscore(historical_volatility_60) used to rank realized volatility cross-sectionally; sector grouping not included to respect KEEP_IN_MIND3. Single field. Confidence 0.58.
Core: ts_ir(divide(implied_volatility_mean_30, historical_volatility_30), 60) to measure consistency of IV relative to HV ratio. Two fields used. Confidence 0.65.
Core: zscore(implied_volatility_mean_skew_120) to find relative skew outliers over medium term. Single field used. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: IV level vs HV momentum composite
results.description: Core: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_20, ts_delta(historical_volatility_20,5)) combining IV level and HV momentum. Two fields used. Confidence 0.61.
Core: ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_call_120, implied_volatility_call_30), 3) to capture rolling change in steepness. Two fields used. Confidence 0.59.

results.idea: Put skew percentile vs long-term IV
results.description: Core: quantile(divide(implied_volatility_put_270, implied_volatility_call_270)) to bucket long-dated put skew pressure. Two fields used; quantile applied. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: IV mean short-term spike relative to 90d mean
results.description: Core: subtract(implied_volatility_mean_10, implied_volatility_mean_90) to detect sudden short-term premium. Two fields used. Confidence 0.66.

Core: ts_regression(historical_volatility_30, ts_step(1), 60, lag=0, rettype=0) to extract regression parameter as momentum proxy. Uses one TS regression op and ts_step; counts as 2 operators and single field. Confidence 0.54.
Core: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_270, implied_volatility_call_30), implied_volatility_call_30) to get percent slope change. Two fields used. Confidence 0.58.
Core: reverse(zscore(implied_volatility_call_10)) to take contrarian positions on extreme short-term IV. Single field cross-sectional zscore reversed. Confidence 0.7.
Core: divide(implied_volatility_mean_skew_60, historical_volatility_60) to see skew relative to realized level. Two fields used. Confidence 0.55.
Core: zscore(subtract(implied_volatility_call_150, implied_volatility_call_60)) to rank mid-term differences. Two fields used. Confidence 0.62.
Core: reverse(ts_delta(historical_volatility_20, 3)) to capture sudden HV drops (mean reversion expectation). Single field used. Confidence 0.56.

results.idea: Put-call skew normalized by IV level
results.description: Core: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_put_60, implied_volatility_call_60), implied_volatility_mean_60) to find relative skew intensity. Two fields used. Confidence 0.6.
Core: subtract(ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_20,3), ts_delta(implied_volatility_call_360,3)) measuring differential acceleration. Two fields used. Confidence 0.58.
Core: zscore(divide(historical_volatility_10, historical_volatility_60)) to find extreme short-term realized jumps. Two fields used. Confidence 0.57.
Core: divide(subtract(implied_volatility_call_1080, implied_volatility_call_360), implied_volatility_call_360) to measure long-term shifts. Two fields used. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Short tenor IV vs mean reversion trigger
results.description: Core: if_else(greater(implied_volatility_call_10, ts_mean(implied_volatility_call_10,30)), reverse(ts_zscore(implied_volatility_call_10,30)), 0). Uses if_else, greater, ts_mean, ts_zscore and reverse with a single field; still <=7 operators and 1 datafield. SUGGESTION1 single-field chosen for clarity. Confidence 0.65.
Core: ts_delta(subtract(implied_volatility_put_120, implied_volatility_call_120), 7) to capture shifts in protective demand. Two fields used. Confidence 0.66.
Core: quantile(divide(implied_volatility_mean_120, implied_volatility_mean_360)) to find relative mid-term cheapness. Two fields used. Confidence 0.61.
